snippet: The administration’s interest in Stanley Fischer appears to reflect a desire for continuity at the Federal Reserve.
abstract: Former and current Obama administration officials say Stanley Fischer, former governor of Bank of Israel and mentor to Federal Reserve's chairman Ben S Bernanke, is leading candidate to become vice chairman of the Fed; he is both surprising choice and popular pick among economists and investors, and interest in him appears to reflect desire for continuity.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Little Rock, Ark.

lead_paragraph: The administration’s interest in Stanley Fischer appears to reflect a desire for continuity at the Federal Reserve.

headline.main: For No. 2 at Fed, White House Favors Central Banker in the Bernanke Mold
headline.print_headline: For No. 2 at Fed, White House Favors Central Banker in the Bernanke Mold
